Summary: Needed an escape and Catalina was on the bucket list.  Villa Del Mar was better than we could have every wished for.  It is the absolute center of town, had the sweetest staff who appeared to authentically want to help you have a great vacation.... and we got cookies and milk every night!  Who could ask for more!  Seriously the room was a Four Seasons quality and if you can afford it, I recommend the Ocean View Suite.  Between the fireplace, huge jacuzzi tub, and balcony that overlooked the beach and the streets below.  The service was phenomenal.  Kellie and Amy were the sweetest!    We will definitely return!

We stayed here for a week. It's a lovely spot and the villa is quite cute inside. It's not huge but was perfect for us. The staff were friendly and the service was great. The view was fantastic and we had a large balcony overlooking the pier. There is a convenience store below which is handy, and plenty of great restaurants around with happy hour specials. The only thing I'll say is that san clemente is expensive. The food and drink is expensive in the area. The other thing is the train. It can be noisy and runs by often with horns blaring and the crossing dinging. Very noisy! Bring earplugs!

Summary Heading: Wonderful location to relax and unwind.
Summary: We had a wonderful stay at the Villa Del Mar. Great service from the hotel staff.  How can you go wrong with the balcony facing the beach. Sunsets every night were spectacular. We enjoyed walking the Pier, watching the surfers from our balcony, and hiking the beach trail.  Beds were very comfortable and the unit was well decorated. The bathroom and kitchen are out dated but who cares when you have this location. Easy walk up the street to amazing restaurants and shopping. Sundays there is a farmer market too. My only true concern if that the water in the shower will go from perfect temp to boiling hot to freezing cold. I kept the water at a lower volocity and seemed to be a little better. We also used our sound soother app on our phone  to drown out the sound of the nightly
Room tip: Our unit was #6 and we had some wrap around windows on the quite side of the building.

Summary: Villa del Mar exceeded my expectations from their online presence. Room #6 was great. What a way to spend the weekend! I am from Riverside and seriously felt like I was on vacation. Check my blog post about Villa del Mar at http://www.closet-creep.com/
Room tip: Right across the street from the Metrolink Drop off

Summary: We have been going to Villa Del Mar for years.  My husband was stationed in San Clemente and we fell in love with its laid back charm.  Over the years Villa Del Mar has increasingly raised its prices .  We last paid 325 a night.  We asked for two beds and got one incredibly uncomfortable queen and one futon that they called " your second bed "  We then requested an additional cot expecting what one would expect - something with a thin mattress.  Instead we received a "cot" that my husband said you could get at Wallmart for twenty dollars - no mattress just a thin piece of foam.  It is never quiet here as the metro link train sits fifty feet away from front of hotel - and runs from early in morning to late at night.  We can deal with the little inconveniences and even the train -

Summary Heading: Couldn't have imagined a better getaway!
Summary: My wife and I just got back from a stay at the Villa Del Mar Hotel in San Clemente CA. We were totally thrilled with the suite, which included a comfortable queen sized bed, living room, kitchen  (with all the utensils you would need for cooking) and clean and nicely appointed bathroom with tub and shower. The huge rectangular living room window looks out over the room's great balcony and beyond to a grand vista of the famous San Clemente Pier and beach. Literally directly across from the pier and within walking distance of San Clemente's uptown, we couldn't have imagined a better getaway. We rode the Amtrak train down and it's stop is conveniently just steps away from the hotel,as are many great and reasonably priced restaurants. Breathtaking views from the balcony or on the

I had a great time at Villa Del Mar! Sitting on my patio watching the sunset was awesome and it couldn't be any easier to go to the beach or the pier with restaurants. The staff was as friendly as any have ever seen. Granted; It is an older property, but it was clean and comfortable. For the price, it's the best! Never mind the  whiners on this board.
Room tip: Get Room 6. Patio and Large window looking at the ocean.

Summary: I WISH I SAW JOHN'S REVIEW BEFORE I CAME HERE!  Shower water comes out fast, its good for my back but hurts my kids & theres no adjustments. Oval toilet seat on a round bowl. small flat screen TV on TV wood stand on corner with statics, can't even see it clear. Night comes and the back hallway is lite up, and it wakes me up every single time. Cannot open windows in back bedroom for ventilation because other guess walks in that hallway. Manager Response: Thank you for your review. I'm very sorry that our beautiful Villa suites did not accommodate your tastes. We strive to provide a relaxing beach environment to all who stay with us.  Unfortunately, there are certainly external factors that we can't control. I would like to point out that we do not advertise a/c in units and, as a matter of fact, it's not really necessary for beach accommodations as the wonderful sea breezes float in through our balcony doors and large screened sliders, such as the one in Suite #4. To add to the breeze, there are 3 ceiling fans in this suite and plenty of windows to open and allow the cool beach air to ventilate your suite.  We have installed brand new High Definition Cox cable boxes in all of our suites to maximize the viewing pleasure of our guests. Every suite is carpeted throughout, with the exception of hallways and bathrooms. We have outfitted every suite with brand new Serta sleeper mattresses.  Our goal is for all guests to feel at home on the beach, and while we can't please everyone's tastes every time, we are working hard every day to make our Villa suites better and better. It is always a pleasure to welcome back any one of the hundreds of repeat guests we've had through the years and hear from them what a special place in their memories we hold.

Summary: This hotel needs serious remodel.  It needs new windows, doors and bathroom. This  hotel is in poor condition.  The balcony door would not close.  The bathroom did not have a fan and the shower enclosure was in bad condition.  The layout of the room was horrible.  The windows are single pane and the walls are not insulated.  When the train went by it sounded like it was in your room.  Very loud.

Mid level unit on the south side. Decor is classical "yard sale". Shower barely works(cold is hot and vise versa). Oval toilet seat on a round bowl. No extension cord so the TV was perched on a stand in the middle of the room. Night comes and the back hallway is lite up like a prison camp. Cannot use windows in back bedroom for ventalation without getting a full daylight effect. Seems there is a crepe restaraunt on the ground floor and the kitchen sit directed below the #4 living room. A column along the living room wall  is the vent stack for a very noisy and vibrating oven/grill fan. The whole living room hummed and the vibration put your feet asleep. Staff kindly gave us a new room at 9Am but what if the rest was full. Not even a question like there was a surprise about the

You can not beat the location and view!  We love San Clemente and it's beach and vibe.  We stayed in room 5 VDM this time (8 last time).  Room was similar.  I don't care that the motif is outdated and somewhat dirty...it's a beach trip.  However, we stayed a week later in the season than last year and the price went up dramatically.  And for almost $300/night, it was harder to swallow the less than impressive room.  The train doesn't really bother me.  But it did get "stuck" at 6am and was ringing for almost 30 min.  Not fun.  I really think this room with a window directly on the outside of the unit, made it louder.  With all this said, I wouldn't even mind all this, IF the staff displayed good customer service.  The younger woman checking me in, was unprofessional and rude.

Summary Heading: Our new favorite spot in SC
Summary: We had another amazing weekend in San Clemente.  Accommodations were the best.  Scenic views from the huge picture windows and spacious balcony.  Amenities made us feel at home with more than enough space for 4 adults.  Office staff is super friendly and accommodating for a special occasion weekend.  You really can't get a better spot than this for the price.  Very affordable!!  No doubt, we will be back... SOON!!  Thank you, thank you Villa Del Mar.
Everything we wanted in a beach get-a-way!!  Location is unbeatable, views From living room and balcony were outstanding. Our family will be going back!  :-)
Super friendly and helpful staff. The apartment had everything you need plus a view to die for. Perfect balcony for laying in the sun or just looking out over the ocean. We loved it.

Summary Heading: A wonderful 4 days with  breathtaking views, great restaurants, bars, shops and a great walking trail along the ocean.
Summary: I first booked at Travel Lodge, web site saying it had ocean view lol. So glad I switched to Villa Del Mar! We were right across from the pier and had a big balcony with a beautiful view of the ocean and Dana Point. Shops and restaurants right down stairs and across the street from the beach and walking trail. The Fisherman's Restaurant was very romantic at night and loved the outside seating with heaters. The room had everything we needed, it's older but who cares with the view and beach right there. I read a review about the train keeping him up, we slept like babies and enjoyed watching it go by during the day. What a great get away without a ton of people, can't wait to get back!

We were lucky enough to spent one lovely night here.  The view in the evening was perfect. We made the short walk accross the road to the Fishermans restaurant which was also great.  The suite was spacious, although felt a little insecure.  This was due to having 3 external doors, all with dodgy locks that didn't seem up to the job!  Despite this little detail, would definately visit again if I pass this way.

Summary Heading: Very casual, old school, family owned beach apt.  We love it.
Summary: Directly across from the beach and pier...you can see the waves break and hear them at night.  Two great surf spots in sight.  No night life right on the beach so its quiet and peaceful.  The night life is walking distance up the hill from the beach.  Nick's has the best Martini I have ever had and their food is great.  Only downside for some (I love it) is the passenger train runs a few times a day along the beach, but only until 11pm.  Kinda cool if you like trains!  You can also hop on the train right there and go to San Diego for the day.  Oh and lets not forget the crepe cafe on the first floor with outside seating and happy hour and sunset on the pier and the owners are really nice and very helpful.  The apts themselves are spacious, casual beachy with large decks on the

We recently spent a weekend at this lovely hotel in a 2 br/2 bth unit.  The views were panoramic.  Spectacular!   Unobstucted views of the beach and pier.   The condo was very clean, and well-appointed with everything needed for a home away from home.  The staff was very friendly and helpful and available to meet all our needs.  We walked to the farmer's market (Sundays), had dinner at the pier, and breakfast at a wonderful restaurant right below the condo that served delicious crepes.  The downtown area is very quaint, with unique shops and a wide range of restaurants.   We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a romantic weekend, as a base for sightseeing or for families wanting a beachfront getaway.  We would undoubtedly book here again, hopefully longer

Summary Heading: paid for a decent room and great view
Summary: We stayed a week in the two bedroom on the third floor.  The bedrooms were quite small and not much other than the double bed and end tables fit in them.  The bathroom was tiny and the kitchen is small too.  Reminds me of a small apartment.  There was a pedestal sink in the bathroom and absolutely no place to put toiletries or anything else for that matter.  There were shelves across the hall from the bathroom and the toiletries had to be put there.  The living room was decently spaced and when we weren't on the beach, we spent all our time there.  The living room had large windows overlooking the ocean and a door leading onto the balcony.  Being right across from the pier, there was people, train and traffic noise but we got used to it after a while.  It was worth it because we

The Hotel was nothing fancy, but still nicer than some have led on.  Check in was fast and simple.  The office was 300 feet away at the Seahorse Inn (people act like it was 9 miles away), I have walked further to get to the desk when I stayed in Las Vegas but nobody complains about that.   The room was a little spendy ($335 a night) but we were only there for one night and we were only in the room to sleep and to relax late in the evening on the deck that had ridiculously good views (see the pictures).   The trains are somewhat bothersome but they stopped around 10:30PM and did not start up until 7:30ish AM I believe.  So if you like to sleep in late you may have problems, of course the mattress in our one bedroom apartment (room 7 I believe) was not all that comfortable so I

For $330.00 a night we got one bedroom apartment furnished with thrift store furniture, disgusting looking kitchen with a faucet that would barely budge, small decrepit bathroom with no toilet paper holder (or enough rolls), tiny and stifling hot bedroom, peeling bathtub, missing window screens, noisy and wobbly ceiling fan, no phone to contact the 'lobby' (down the street in another 'hotel'), torn and frayed deck chair pads, tv with bad reception, doors that needed a wrestler to shut...But the beach was great. (and free). Stay AWAY!!!!

My girlfriend highly recommended this property due to it's location, and it was in very close proximity to the beach and the pier.  However, the property is located right at the railroad crossing and anyone who knows anything about trains knows that they blow their whistle when they're nearing the railroad crossing.  And much to my dismay, there were a lot of trains!  Usually the first train came through around 6:30 a.m., and they continued all day and into the evening until about 1 a.m.  Amtrak, Metrolink, and freight trains all the time, which made a good nights sleep almost impossible.    And, as a previous reviewer mentioned, the wall unit air conditioner did not work.  You need the air on in July because 1.  The room faces the ocean/sun, and 2.  The windows facing the ocean

We paid around $330 + tax  for a one night stay at the Villa Del Mar Inn.  The Inn is actually a converted apartment.  No real front desk or lobby (you check in at another inn down the block, no one to call upon after 8pm.)  The furniture, linens, and rug are dreadfully cheap.  There is no working air conditioner, and boy did it get hot at night.  Too hot for any of us to sleep comfortably, especially the kids.  Our place was right next to the dumpster, so leaving the windows open at night was NOT a good idea.  There is a kitchen, but not stocked with anything you need (no knives, bottle opener, pots/pans, dishwasher.)
